Container.Name: storm
Container.Overview:
Introducing Storm
A slick remote interface for Deluge that fully supports mobile devices (including as a home-screen app)
You'll need a Deluge container running with a valid auth configuration as shown here: https://dev.deluge-torrent.org/wiki/UserGuide/Authentication Storm needs a way to contact the Deluge RPC daemon so it's best that you create a Docker network and attach the Storm container to that network. Once that's setup you'll need to configure Deluge to allow remote RPC connections: - Open up core.conf in your Deluge configuration folder and set - "allow_remote": true
Security
By default, Storm does not authenticate requests made to the API. When serving Storm over the public internet you should ensure access to your Deluge daemon is properly secured. - Storm comes with a simple built-in authentication mechanism which can be enabled with the environment variable STORM_API_KEY or the command-line option --api-key. - Set this to a reasonably secure password. Any requests made to Storm must now provide the API key in the request. You should also seriously consider the use of HTTPS over the internet, with services like LetsEncrypt it's relatively easy to get a valid SSL certificate for free.

Config.Name: WebUI
Config.Description: WebUI port to access your deluge installation via storm

Config.Name: DELUGE_RPC_HOSTNAME
Config.Description: Change this to the current name for the deluge container you want to connect storm's webUI to

Config.Name: DELUGE_RPC_USERNAME
Config.Description:
The username storm will use to connect to the deluge container.
Set this in appdata\deluge\auth file

Config.Name: DELUGE_RPC_PASSWORD
Config.Description:
The password storm will use to connect to the deluge container.
Set this in appdata\deluge\auth file

Config.Name: DELUGE_RPC_VERSION
Config.Description: RPC connection version to use. Depends on your deluge version.
